name: places/ChIJ_Wry6v9ZwokRqCbTkj9vveU
formattedAddress: 222 E 51st St, New York, NY 10022, USA
adrFormatAddress: 222 E 51st St, New York, NY 10022, USA

originalText.text: Pho was a good sized portion and cheap for the amount. Meat however was not fresh and dry for both the pork chop bahn mi and chicken taco. The picked veggies were all shifted to one side of the sandwich so when I went to split half with my friend, I had no veggies. I also ordered a flank and brisket pho, added $4 extra for pork chop and ended up when what tasted like day old pork chop floating around my soup. Soggy on the outside, dry on the inside. Soup tasted pretty good though. Prices are great for the area.

originalText.text:
The Pho 6 is a really small and trendy restaurant that has pretty good food and reasonable prices.

My issue with the restaurant is purely based on its Pho. The broth is WAY too oily. If that doesn’t bother you then take this review with a grain of salt.

I usually go to Pho Saigon on First Ave. which has some of the best Pho I’ve ever had; but Pho 6 is much closer to my office. I have dined in, but this time I got through ritual so it was a take out order for beef and brisket Pho.

The portion size is small, but they offer a good amount of noodles and meat which is a plus. However, after you finish that and look at your bowl you are left with an unappetizing amount of oil floating at the top of your bowl. They also mixed the hoisin sauce with the Sriracha which was annoying cause I don’t like both in my Pho.

If they fix the oil situation they would be in 4 star territory. I am going to let the photos speak for themselves.

originalText.text:
Order grilled chicken pho and flank beef pho! Each of them is 11 dollars! The beef is nice but very small portion! Noodle and soup is served in a really big bowl!
Soup and pho is both nice but a little salty！
Will come back again next time!

originalText.text: Simple basic menu with limited items and an option to change the meat in main course. Small place with hand full of seats and a small kitchen. Noodle soup bowl has huge portion and combo sandwich is pretty decent.

text.text: Simple basic menu with limited items and an option to change the meat in main course. Small place with hand full of seats and a small kitchen. Noodle soup bowl has huge portion and combo sandwich is pretty decent.

originalText.text: Deliciously slurpy nice pho-grilled pork. Love the chewy texture of the noodle. Soup is flavourful. My favourite so far. It’s a big bowl for me but I finished it. Menu selection is quite limited. A pity that hot drinks are not available. Service was ok.
